intro: Purpurella minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered purplebell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, violet to purple blooms that are often clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Purpurella minutiflora thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
